result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt:
of Commitment for Treatment.
Sent manually to Judge to fill out Credit days and to sign.

02:56 PM   Attorney Dan Tombasco appeared for the State. Defendant, Hailey M Thompson, appeared with Attorney Seth Elijah Johnson.  Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: Parties stipulate to the report. Court finds the DE not competent but likely to regain competency. Deft is committed to the Dept of Health Services.  DHS shall determine the placement. Reports shall be submitted at three mos intervals.  Court suspends proceedings, and remediation is ordered.  Status conference scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

*Involuntary medication order was not granted. NN 9/7/2022*
and Comp Report
Competency hearing on August 31, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
At the request of WI Forensic Unit, CH rescheduled to 8/31/22 @ 2:30pm. Attys to confirm by email, and NTBS.

Submitted by WFU
re:  Comp Eval Extension

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  No contact including the residence or 3rd party with: no contact with animals, no contact with Robin S., Coy R. and Christine E. - written and electronic contact allowed.

09:38 AM   State appears by Attorney Alexander Huber.  No appearance by the Defendant. Attorney Seth Elijah Johnson appeared.  Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES:  Victim rights compliance. Attorney Johnson's motion to modify bond. Discussion held. State does not object. Court modifies bond to permit written contact with Robin S., Coy R. and Christine E.. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.
Court will no longer be available on 8/3/22 so hearing moved to 8/4/22 at 8:30 AM and parties have been notified.
to Modify Bond.

Attorney Drew Lehman appeared for the Prosecution. Defendant Hailey M Thompson appeared with Attorney Seth Elijah Johnson.  Defendant in custody. Clerk: S.Shaw.
MINUTES: Matter here on Competency Hearing. Deft was not able to complete evaluation. Dr. Request's an extension. Extension granted. Matter set over.  Competency hearing scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
